CHAPTER XIII

OF LIGHTNING

Havnuo now treated of fire and light, let me add a lew remarks on lightning, since it seems to waver between fiame and light. ¹

In the first place thenas to lightning, it is not to be supposed that any flame discharged from a flashing cloud reaches the eye. For who can conceive a flame so vast and swilt as to spread in a moment over . almost the whole hemisphere.
